sentences: Muinasjutu kuri nõid muutis kuningatütre kiviks.
context: The Estonian word 'nõid' refers to a witch, shaman, sorcerer or wizard - someone who practices magic and deals with supernatural world through various means and actions. It can refer to historical figures like shamans in Lapland and the North, as well as characters from fairy tales who might perform magical transformations. The term has both neutral (practitioner of magic) and negative (evil woman, witch) connotations depending on context.
